00037 #include "egs_pyramid.h"
00038 #include "egs_input.h"
00039 #include "egs_functions.h"
00040 
00041 #include <vector>
00042 using std::vector;
00043 
00044 static EGS_PYRAMID_LOCAL string __pyrX = "EGS_PyramidX";
00045 static EGS_PYRAMID_LOCAL string __pyrY = "EGS_PyramidY";
00046 static EGS_PYRAMID_LOCAL string __pyrZ = "EGS_PyramidZ";
00047 static EGS_PYRAMID_LOCAL string __pyr  = "EGS_Pyramid";
00048 
00049 template<class T>
00050 EGS_PyramidT<T>::EGS_PyramidT(T *P, const EGS_Vector &Xo, bool O,
00051     const string &Name) : EGS_BaseGeometry(Name), p(P), xo(Xo),
00052     a(p->getNormal()), open(O) {
00053     nreg = 1;
00054     d = p->distance(xo); xop = p->getProjection(xo);
00055     if( fabs(d) < 1e-7 ) egsFatal("%s: the tip is too close to"
00056             " the base (%g)\n",getType().c_str(),fabs(d));
00057     if( d < 0 ) { a *= (-1); d *= (-1); }
00058     EGS_Vector v2 = p->getPoint(0), v1;
00059     n = p->getN(); s = new EGS_Polygon * [n];
00060     vector<EGS_2DVector> aux;
00061     for(int j=0; j<p->getN(); j++) {
00062         v1 = v2; v2 = p->getPoint(j+1);
00063         EGS_Vector aj = p->getNormal(j);
00064         EGS_Projector *pro = new EGS_Projector(v1,xo,v2,"");
00065         EGS_Vector n = pro->normal();
00066         if( n*aj < 0 ) {
00067             delete pro; pro = new EGS_Projector(v2,xo,v1,"");
00068             n = pro->normal();
00069             if( n*aj < 0 )
00070                 egsFatal("%s: n*aj < 0 for both normal orientations?\n",
00071                         getType().c_str());
00072         }
00073         aux.push_back(pro->getProjection(v1));
00074         aux.push_back(pro->getProjection(xo));
00075         aux.push_back(pro->getProjection(v2));
00076         s[j] = new EGS_Polygon(aux,*pro,open);
00077         aux.clear(); delete pro;
00078     }
00079     is_convex = p->isConvex();
00080 }
00081 
00082 template<class T>
00083 void EGS_PyramidT<T>::printInfo() const {
00084     EGS_BaseGeometry::printInfo();
00085 }

00087 extern "C" {
00088 
00089 EGS_PYRAMID_EXPORT EGS_BaseGeometry* createGeometry(EGS_Input *input) {
00090 
00091     if( !input ) {
00092         egsWarning("createGeometry(pyramid): null input?\n");
00093         return 0;
00094     }
00095     string type;
00096     int err = input->getInput("type",type);
00097     if( err ) {
00098         egsWarning("createGeometry(pyramid): missing 'type' input\n");
00099         return 0;
00100     }
00101     EGS_BaseGeometry *g;
00102     vector<EGS_Float> p;
00103     err = input->getInput("points",p);
00104     if( err ) {
00105         egsWarning("createGeometry(pyramid): missing 'points' input\n");
00106         return 0;
00107     }
00108     vector<EGS_Float> tip;
00109     err = input->getInput("tip",tip);
00110     if( err || tip.size() != 3 ) {
00111         egsWarning("createGeometry(pyramid): wrong/missing 'tip' input\n");
00112         return 0;
00113     }
00114     bool o = true;
00115     int is_closed;
00116     err = input->getInput("closed",is_closed);
00117     if( !err && is_closed == 1 ) o = false;
00118     egsWarning("%s: open = %d\n",type.c_str(),o);
00119     if( input->compare(type,__pyrX) || input->compare(type,__pyrY) ||
00120         input->compare(type,__pyrZ) ) {
00121         int np = p.size()/2;
00122         if( np < 3 ) {
00123             egsWarning("createGeometry(pyramid): at least 3 points are "
00124                     "required to construct a pyramid\n"); return 0;
00125         }
00126         vector<EGS_2DVector> points;
00127         for(int j=0; j<np; j++) points.push_back(EGS_2DVector(p[2*j],p[2*j+1]));
00128         if( input->compare(type,__pyrX) )
00129             g=new EGS_PyramidX(new
00130                     EGS_PolygonYZ(points,EGS_XProjector(__pyrX)),
00131                     EGS_Vector(tip[0],tip[1],tip[2]),o);
00132         else if( input->compare(type,__pyrY) )
00133             g=new EGS_PyramidY(new EGS_PolygonXZ(points,
00134                     EGS_YProjector(__pyrY)),
00135                     EGS_Vector(tip[0],tip[1],tip[2]),o);
00136         else
00137             g=new EGS_PyramidZ(new
00138                     EGS_PolygonXY(points,EGS_ZProjector(__pyrZ)),
00139                     EGS_Vector(tip[0],tip[1],tip[2]),o);
00140     }
00141     else {
00142         int np = p.size()/3;
00143         if( np < 3 ) {
00144             egsWarning("createGeometry(pyramid): at least 3 points are required"
00145                     " to construct a pyramid\n"); return 0;
00146         }
00147         vector<EGS_Vector> points;
00148         for(int j=0; j<np; j++)
00149             points.push_back(EGS_Vector(p[3*j],p[3*j+1],p[3*j+2]));
00150         EGS_Vector aux(points[np-1]-points[0]);
00151         if( aux.length2() > 1e-6 ) points.push_back(points[0]);
00152         np = points.size();
00153         EGS_Projector pro(points[0],points[1],points[np-2],__pyr);
00154         vector<EGS_2DVector> p2;
00155         {for(int j=0; j<np; j++) {
00156             p2.push_back(pro.getProjection(points[j]));
00157             EGS_Float d = pro.distance(points[j]);
00158             if( fabs(d) > 1e-6 ) {
00159                 egsWarning("createGeometry(pyramid): "
00160                         "points are not on a plane\n"); return 0;
00161             }
00162         }}
00163         g = new EGS_Pyramid(new EGS_Polygon(p2,pro),
00164                 EGS_Vector(tip[0],tip[1],tip[2]),o);
00165     }
00166     g->setName(input);
00167     g->setMedia(input);
00168     g->setLabels(input);
00169     return g;
00170 }
00171
